Base:Descriptions.Base:Description: The Copper Claw Tavern

The main room is about twelve feet wide, and twelve feet long. This room continues south into the barroom. A swinging oak at the eastern end of the southern wall leads into the tidy kitchen. A reconstructed fireplace lives in the west wall, and above it hangs a decorative portrait. Oak tables and chairs are available to the hungry and weary.

The main room is about twelve feet wide, and twelve feet long. This room continues south into the barroom. A swinging oak at the eastern end of the southern wall leads into the tidy kitchen. A reconstructed fireplace lives in the west wall, and above it hangs a decorative portrait. Oak tables and chairs are available to the hungry and weary.

The main room is about twelve feet wide, and twelve feet long. This room continues south into the barroom. A swinging oak at the eastern end of the southern wall leads into the tidy kitchen. A reconstructed fireplace lives in the west wall, and above it hangs a decorative portrait. Oak tables and chairs are available to the hungry and weary.
an oak door leading north
An oak door leads to the north. $(parent-desc)
An oak door leads to the north. $(parent-desc)
the middle of the tavern to the south
The southern side of the dining area merges into the barroom. $(parent-desc)
a swinging oak door leading southeast
A swinging oak door to the kitchen. When opened or closed it is now soundless, and clings securely to the metal hinges. $(parent-desc)
A swinging oak door to the kitchen. When opened or closed it is now soundless, and clings securely to the metal hinges. $(parent-desc)
You push through the swinging oak door and enter the main room of The Copper Claw Tavern.
pushes {$(actor.base:possessive) |$(actor.base:possessive)} way through the swinging oak door and arrives here. The door doesn't make a peep as it returns seamlessly to its starting position.

pushes {$(actor.base:possessive) |$(actor.base:possessive)} way through the swinging oak door and enters the tidy kitchen of The Copper Claw Tavern. The door doesn't make a peep as it returns seamlessly to its starting position.
the patterned ceiling
The main room has a raised ceiling that has been recently repaired and safely reinforced. A distinctive, carved ivy pattern worn with age, but beautiful nonetheless, decorates the edges.
The room has a raised ceiling that has been recently repaired and safely reinforced.
the restored chimney

The fieldstone chimney rises, as a continuation of the fireplace, against the western wall to the ceiling. The stones have all been recently replaced and adequately supported so as to avoid swift dilapidation in the future.

The fieldstone chimney rises, as a continuation of the fireplace, against the western wall to the ceiling. The stones have all been recently replaced and adequately supported so as to avoid swift dilapidation in the future.

The fieldstone chimney rises, as a continuation of the fireplace, against the western wall to the ceiling. The stones have all been recently replaced and adequately supported so as to avoid swift dilapidation in the future.
the simple oak floor
A simple oak floor that was recently repaired. Here and there planks of oak in varying grades of light and dark lend a patchwork appearance to the room.
decorative portrait

A decorative portrait displaying a group of people clustered outside the local chapel for mass has been hung here. The various visages cling to their prayer beads, smile at one another, and seem to be mid-conversation.

A decorative portrait displaying a group of people clustered outside the local chapel for mass has been hung here. The various visages cling to their prayer beads, smile at one another, and seem to be mid-conversation.
the eastern wall

The close-studded, half-timbered western wall is constructed of dark, unpainted oak posts (the studs) and a few diagonal arch-braces, joined with mortises and pegs, and all less than perfectly flat and square. Few of the studs are of the same width, and some have slight curves or uneven surfaces. The arch-braces rise from some of the larger posts, and curve slightly 'inward' as they rise to support the ceiling beams. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, whitewashed plaster, laid over laths or wattle-work covered with clay mixed with horse-hair. These panels are recessed about half an inch beyond the surrounding wooden framing. The wall is about eight feet high; a glass sliding door is set in the middle of the wall.

These panels are recessed about half an inch beyond the surrounding wooden framing. The wall is about eight feet high; a glass sliding door is set in the middle of the wall.

the northern wall

The close-studded, half-timbered northern wall is constructed of dark, unpainted oak posts (the studs) and a few diagonal arch-braces, joined with mortises and pegs, and all in various stages of decay. Few of the studs are of the same width, and many have slight curves or uneven surfaces. The arch-braces rise from some of the larger posts and provide a sturdy support for the ceiling beams. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, whitewashed plaster, laid over laths or wattle-work covered with clay mixed with horse-hair. These panels are recessed about half an inch beyond the surrounding wooden framing. The wall is about eight feet high; the main oak door is set near its western end. A glazed casement window recently cleaned and roughly square, is set in the middle of the northern wall.

Few of the studs are of the same width, and many have slight curves or uneven surfaces. The arch-braces rise from some of the larger posts and provide a sturdy support for the ceiling beams. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, whitewashed plaster, laid over laths or wattle-work covered with clay mixed with horse-hair. These panels are recessed about half an inch beyond the surrounding wooden framing. The wall is about eight feet high; the main oak door is set near its western end. A glazed casement window recently cleaned and roughly square, is set in the middle of the northern wall.

the short southern wall

The close-studded, half-timbered southern wall is constructed of dark, unpainted oak posts (the studs) and a few diagonal arch-braces, joined with mortises and pegs, and all in various stages of decay. Few of the studs are of the same width, and many have slight curves or uneven surfaces. The arch-braces rise from some of the larger posts to sturdily support the ceiling beams. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, whitewashed plaster, laid over laths or wattle-work covered with clay mixed with horse-hair. These panels are recessed about half an inch beyond the surrounding wooden framing. In this partial wall hangs a swinging oak door to the kitchen.

Few of the studs are of the same width, and many have slight curves or uneven surfaces. The arch-braces rise from some of the larger posts to sturdily support the ceiling beams. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, whitewashed plaster, laid over laths or wattle-work covered with clay mixed with horse-hair. These panels are recessed about half an inch beyond the surrounding wooden framing. In this partial wall hangs a swinging oak door to the kitchen.

the western wall

The close-studded, half-timbered western wall is constructed of dark, unpainted oak posts (the studs) and a few diagonal arch-braces, joined with mortises and pegs, and all in various stages of decay. Few of the studs are of the same width, and many have slight curves or uneven surfaces. The arch-braces rise from some of the larger posts to sturdily support the ceiling beams. Between the wooden posts and braces are panels of rough, whitewashed plaster, laid over laths or wattle-work covered with clay mixed with horse-hair. These panels are recessed about half an inch beyond the surrounding wooden framing. Dead center of this wall is a reconstructed fireplace complete with a restored chimney. Hanging above it is a decorative portrait of a crowd gathering for mass.

Hanging above it is a decorative portrait of a crowd gathering for mass.
the main window

A glazed casement window which has been recently cleaned and is roughly square. It is set in the middle of the northern wall. It provides a clear view through its small glass panes, of the east commons. At a glance:

A glazed casement window which has been recently cleaned and is roughly square. It is set in the middle of the northern wall. It provides a clear view through its small glass panes, of the east commons. At a glance:

A glazed casement window which has been recently cleaned and is roughly square. It is set in the middle of the northern wall. It provides a clear view through its small glass panes, of the east commons. At a glance:

Core:Properties.Core:Property: X[S] \{Unfamiliar travelers sit on some of the nearby chairs, grabbing a bite to eat before departing to unknown destinations. \|An odorous beggar rifles through his money pouch, searching for enough change to buy a slice of bread before disappearing back onto the street outside. \|A group of local fisherman sit around the table in the southwest corner sharing a meal and chatting about recent events. \|A petite slender woman travels about the room clearing off the tables for her next customers. \|A gentleman with a twinkle in his eye smoothly pulls out a chair for the female in his company. With a smile and a faint blush she thanks him, and begins conversing indecisively about meal options. \|A petite slender woman moves in and out of the group of people, gathering empty cups and dishes as she passes. \| A petite slender woman briefly disappears through the kitchen door before returning with more plates of hot food.\}

With a smile and a faint blush she thanks him, and begins conversing indecisively about meal options. \|A petite slender woman moves in and out of the group of people, gathering empty cups and dishes as she passes. \| A petite slender woman briefly disappears through the kitchen door before returning with more plates of hot food.\}
